analysis_results.food_name: chicken in tomato-based sauce (e.g., chicken tikka/masala)
major_uncertainties: Could be a meat (chicken) piece or a vegetarian protein such as paneer or tofu — paneer is much higher in calories per 100g than chicken or tofu.
Could be a fried/breaded item (higher calories) versus a grilled/braised piece (lower calories).
Sauce composition is unclear — a cream-based sauce would add substantially more calories than a simple tomato/herb sauce.
analysis_results.most_important_question: Is this item cooked chicken (meat) or a vegetarian protein such as paneer/tofu?

major_uncertainties: Could be regular cooked rice (white or brown) versus cauliflower 'rice' — cauliflower rice is far lower in calories (~25 kcal/100g) than cooked rice (~120–150 kcal/100g).
Could be plain steamed rice versus a pilaf/fried rice with added fat or ingredients, which would raise calories noticeably.
Could be another grain (quinoa/couscous) with a different calorie density, though appearance most closely matches rice.
analysis_results.most_important_question: Is the highlighted item regular cooked rice (white or brown/quinoa) or is it cauliflower 'rice' (made from grated cauliflower)?

analysis_results.food_name: roasted/baked tomato halves with sauce and herbs (best guess)
major_uncertainties: Could be plain roasted tomato halves (very low calories) OR a cheese-topped mini pizza/gratin (much higher calories if cheese/cream is present).
Could be a piece of meat (e.g., chicken) or paneer coated in sauce rather than a vegetable — protein/cheese vs vegetable causes large calorie differences.
Visible sauce/oil and toppings make it unclear how much high-fat ingredient (cheese, cream, oil) is present, which greatly affects calories.
The segmented region is small and might include dense ingredients (cheese/paneer) not obvious from the top view, changing calorie density substantially.
analysis_results.most_important_question: Is the highlighted item a roasted/tomato vegetable (just tomatoes with herbs) or is it topped/filled with cheese or meat (e.g., mini pizza, paneer, or chicken)?
